Portuguese parliamentary corpus ParlaMint-PT-en, Series I, Term XV [ParlaMint-en.ana SAMPLE]
Minutas da Assembleia da República Portuguesa, Sessão 2, Número 41
Minutes of the Assembly of the Portuguese Republic, Session 2, Number 41

respStmt.resp: Machine translation to English and linguistic analysis of the translation
Annotating MTed corpora with USAS semantic tags

funder.orgName: OSCARS (Open Science Clusters' Action for Research & Society)
Centre of Linguistics of the University of Lisbon

availability.p: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License

bibl.title: Minutes of the Assembleia da República of Portugal

projectDesc.p: ParlaMint is a project that aims to (1) create a multilingual set of comparable corpora of parliamentary proceedings uniformly encoded according to the ParlaMint encoding guidelines, covering the period from 2015 to mid-2022; (2) add linguistic annotations to the corpora and machine-translate them to English; (3) make the corpora available through concordancers; and (4) build use cases in Political Sciences and Digital Humanities based on the corpus data.

prefixDef.p: Private URIs with this prefix point to aligned source elements of the MTed corpus.

revisionDesc.change: Tomaž Erjavec: Include topic and sentiment related information.

div.head: Quinta-feira, 8 de fevereiro de 2024 I Série — Número 41
XV LEGISLATURA 2.ª SESSÃO LEGISLATIVA (2023-2024)
COMISSÃO PERMANENTE
div.note: Chairman: H.E. Mr. Augusto Ernesto Santos Silva
Secretaries: Ex.mos Sr. Maria da Luz Gameiro Beja Ferreira Rosinha Duarte Rogério Matos Ventura Pacheco

SUMMARY The President declared the meeting open at 3 p.m. and 4 minutes. The President then proceeded to read the messages of the President of the Republic on the non-promulgation of the Decrees of the Assembly of the Republic No 127/XV — Establishing the legal framework for the issuance of administrative measures to be adopted by schools for the implementation of Law No 38/2018 of 7 August and amending it and amending it and 132/XV — Amending the system for the allocation of the name and of endorsements to birth and marriage seats, amending the Civil Register Code. In a political statement, Pedro Filipe Soares (BE) reflected on the increase in bank profits in 2023, attributing it to the financial margin of the Portuguese banks when compared to the European average. In a political statement, Mrs Joana Sá Pereira (PS) spoke about the pay increases in security forces since 2015 and warned about the need for their rights of demonstration to be exercised in accordance with the law. In a political statement, Mr. Joaquim Miranda Sarmento (PSD) criticized the Government for the current state of public services in general, as well as for the latest demonstrations of farmers and security forces. In a political statement, Mr Pedro Pinto (CH) condemned the conduct of the current Secretary-General of the PS, Pedro Nuno Santos, and members of the current government, underlining the existence of corruption schemes in politics over the 50 years of democracy. In a political statement, Mrs Joana Cordeiro (IL) negatively appreciated socialist governance and called for a change of policy in the country, presenting the measures that her party defends. In a political statement, Mrs Alma Rivera (PCP) defended measures to respond to the worsening of the structural deficits resulting from the right-wing policy and encouraged the vote on her party to safeguard the defence of the values of justice and solidarity. The President closed the meeting for 15 hours and 54 minutes.
